title: Allow users to install modules form a private forge repository
Add site to default search path
last_comment:
@scotje , @binford2k Yes. Puppet Strings does appear to be intended only to document a single module. I haven't finished my work to document a Control Repo using Puppet Strings, but you can see my work in progress [here](https://github.com/alexharv074/elk/commit/eef7206d857af5e7bc0b02bf7c4c44f27f43a119). After applying the patch in this pull request, I could generate Markdown from classes inside a site directory.

See also how I used Puppet Strings [here](https://github.com/alexharv074/puppet-firewall_multi/blob/master/.README.erb#L3-L34) and [here](https://github.com/alexharv074/puppet-firewall_multi/blob/master/.README.erb#L104) to include Markdown in one of my module's READMEs, and my blog post [here](https://alexharv074.github.io/2018/11/09/generating-markdown-from-source-code-in-erb.html) on how I generally use ERB to generate nearly all my README files. Since I think all duplication in docs is bad, I do think Puppet Strings's job should be extended beyond just documenting modules.
